tenpin.name: accelerometer
tenpin.description: Detect orientation and movement of your Tessel by measuring gravity / acceleration. 3-axis digital accelerometer; 12-bit resolution; selectable ±2g/±4g/±8g scales

tenpin.name: ambient
tenpin.description: The Ambient sensor can detect ambient light and sound levels. Clap to turn on the TV (paired with infrared) or know from a webapp if the lights are on at home. The microphone is optimized for detecting the ambient noise level in a room or building a sound-activated device. The ambient light sensor and can be used for detecting fine-grain brightness in a room.

tenpin.name: audio
tenpin.description: Decode audio files or streams and output; record audio. Decodes MP3/AAC/WMA/MIDI/FLAC/Ogg Vorbis files; Supports files and streams; Supports both headphones and line-out; Can record audio through an on-board microphone or line-in jack

tenpin.name: ble
tenpin.description: Allows your tesselation to work as a Bluetooth LE master or slave device. Connect to your phone, FitBit, or other low-powered device. Compatible with iOS 5+, Android 4.3+; Supports master mode to connect to other BLE devices and Tessels

tenpin.name: camera
tenpin.description: Add the sense of sight to Tessel! Take pictures of your projects, from your projects.

tenpin.name: climate
tenpin.description: Detect humidity and temperature from your environment. Measure 0 to 70 °C (32 to 160 °F) with ±1° accuracy; Measure 0% to 80% relative humidity

tenpin.name: diy
tenpin.description: Build your own module! This single- or double-wide module comes with a guide on how to connect anything to Tessel. Protoboard module exposes SPI, I2C, UART, and GPIO; Ground and 3.3V rails make it easy to power components; For larger projects, available in a double-wide size (like the RFID module)

tenpin.name: gprs
tenpin.description: Connect your Tessel anywhere with GPRS/SIM card support for 2G internet! Make a call on the Tessel phone, or have your Tessel send you texts. Max downlink 85.6 kbps; Max uplink 42.8 kbps; Supports SIM cards at 1.8v and 3v

tenpin.name: gps
tenpin.description: Detect your global position. Helps you figure out where you are - and where you're going. Up to 1.8m accuracy; 66 search channels; 22 tracking channels; -165dBM sensitivity; Max 10Hz update rate

tenpin.name: infrared
tenpin.description: The Infrared (IR) Module can send and detect IR signals. Use a Tessel as a remote for your TV, radio, or even another Tessel. Transmits and receives from 30+ feet (line of sight); Detects max 38kHz; IR Receiver; IR LED

tenpin.name: microsd
tenpin.description: Reads high-density media from microSD cards. Store pictures or other data locally on your Tessel. Reads/writes microSD cards; Module ships with a 1GB MicroSD card

tenpin.name: relay
tenpin.description: Control high-current devices, such as power cords and appliances. Rated for 240V and 5A; AC or DC current; Secure and remove wires with the help of a ballpoint pen. No more loose wires or screwdrivers.

tenpin.name: rfid
tenpin.description: Read RFID cards/NFC. 13.56 MHx; Support CharlieCards, Clipper Cards, and other metro cards; Comes with a Mifare Classic RFID card

tenpin.name: servo
tenpin.description: Control up to 16 hobbyist/RC servos. Make it move! Control locks, wheels, cords, or anything else you can think of. Standard PWM output is compatible with servos of all sizes; Comes with an ES3001 YinYan Servo and a 5V external power jack (US-style plug)

community.name: button
community.description: Add a button to your Tessel. Press and release events; add several buttons if you want!

community.name: color sensor
community.description: This RGB Color Sensor is like an eyedropper tool for the real world. Find the red, green, blue, or clear levels of anything you point it at. The API gives you access to the raw RGBC data, color temperatures, and lux intensity.

community.name: Gesture sensor: APDS-9960
community.description: A gesture sensor. It can detect swiping motions in 4 directions. Also has an RGB sensor; Can detect near and far gestures

community.name: matrix keypad
community.description: Take basic keyboard input over Tessel for new interactions. Press and release evernts.

community.name: trellis keypad
community.description: Adafruit's Trellis 4x4 backlit keypad. This module provides a simple interface to the HT16K33 RAM Mapped LED driver that is the heart of the Adafruit Trellis system. Straight-forward button/LED access with row-column coordinates; Button press and release events; Brightness and blink control

community.name: led backpack-ht16k33
community.description: 8x8 Matrix LED Display. Small LED matrix display. Intuitive API makes it easy to see outputs.

community.name: lego
community.description: If you have a Tessel infrared module, you can use this software module to connect to LEGO infrared control! Works with the LEGO Power Functions infrared receiver. Control your LEGO creations from the internet!

community.name: motion detector
community.description: Detect motion– know when something's happening. Infrared-based technology; Events fired on motion

community.name: motor driver tb6612
community.description: Drive one or two small motors with Tessel. Use bigger motors than the Servo module is meant for.

community.name: RGB LED lights
community.description: Use Adafruit's individually addressable LED lights easily with this abstracted library. Easily create animations; Getting-started examples included; Works best with LED strips

community.name: OLED Display
community.description: OLED is a relatively new display technology, the same used in OLED TVs. Emits bright light (no backlight needed). 128x64px

community.name: Proximity Sensor HCSR04
community.description: Sense distance in centimeters with the ultrasound proximity sensor. Control volume with a wave of your hand. Great for robotics projects; Extremely intuitive interaction

community.name: Proximity Sensor SEN10737p
community.description: Sense distance in centimeters with the ultrasound proximity sensor. Control volume with a wave of your hand. Great for robotics projects; Extremely intuitive interaction

community.name: pulse sensor
community.description: Sense your pulse and fire events with each heartbeat. Non-invasive; Easy setup; Great way to get started with biosensing

community.name: Nokia Screen
community.description: A basic graphic LCD screen, this cheap display lets you add UI to your Tessel project. 48 rows x 84 columns; Black and white; Connection instructions included

community.name: thermal printer
community.description: A thermal printer, also known as a receipt printer. Print text, barcodes, bitmap graphics, and QR codes. Black and white.
